name: Incline Dumbbell Row
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on the edge of an incline bench or a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your arms extended and hanging straight down from under your shoulders.
3. Lean back slightly so that your body is at an angle to the bench.
4. Lift the dumbbells off the ground and bend your elbows to bring the weights towards your ribcage. Focus on squeezing your lat muscles at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly return the dumbbells to the starting position by extending your arms fully, keeping control throughout the exercise.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Incline Dumbbell Rows are an upper body exercise that primarily targets the latissimus dorsi muscle and can be modified to suit different fitness levels.
